page.title: 14MUSEUM AND LIBRARY
page.content: THE {museum}moved to its present home in 1858 and its independent funding by the Orkney Natural History Society is jealously guarded. It has 6 monthly exhibitions,Orkney/Stromness based.The most popular was 'SCAPA FLOW'and the current one is 'SINKING OF ROYAL OAK Mrs.Firth,the curator,aged 62,and curator for 23 years,values all exhibits esp.stuffed birds. The {library,}built in 1900, has about 200 members who borrow around 1400 books every week from its 9000 stock.Children can take out 2 and adults 6. Valuable old Orkney books are kept in the building for reference there. All topics are covered and there's large print books for those with poor eyesight. A reading room has newspapers and many come to read them. Sadly many books are never returned.
